content.description: A quality highball with a slightly better landing than the other routes on this wall. Start on two high jugs 2 feet right of the rightmost tree near the face. Climb up the tall face past a sidepull and horizontals to an intimidating topout. Be sure to scope out the topout before attempting this route.
content.protection: Pads and spotters, this is a very tall climb with a tree in the landing area.
content.location: The rightmost route on the Holy Face, just to the right of a tree.

content.description: Stand start on the right facing sidepull crimp and a good foothold. Move up through an oddly shaped left pocket to a sloping horizonal shelf. Move mostly straight up through sloper jug shelves and a sloper jug heuco to the tall lip of the boulder. Pulling over the lip 6 inches to the right tends to be more clean. This line can easily be rehearsed on toprope from a tree anchor.
content.location: This is the tallest established line on the holy face starting just left of the last tree in the small alley.
